5XEcv9NlqmJj-pNOkQt1Ew.text: Instagram wins again!  The insta-famous photos circulating the gram are a lot prettier than the presentation. I'm that obnoxious girl that doesn't like her food touching and Volcano Grille piles everything I MEAN EVERYTHING salad included into one tin container with a lid.   Competitive pricing for the variety + portion offered but my good was cold to be transparent.    I ordered a lunch bowl $7.99  1 Protein (shrimp) 1 Half Side (egg roll)  1 Rice or NOODLE

_V1vo8X21V0Y7MxYeR3fOg.text: Fooled again, damn you Instagram!  The pics of the food here look so tantalizing but once again the flavor is completely lacking!  I got a bowl with chicken breast, filet minion, noodles, seaweed salad and grilled veggies.  The chicken was super dry and terribly bland; same with the veggies despite visible grill marks and seasoning; the noodles were doused in a sweet teriaky type sauce that was totally one note; the seaweed salad tastes pretty much the same as when you get it at a sushi restaurant; the filet minion was on point, very tender and flavorful but not worth the almost $2 upgrade especially with the rest of the meal being so disappointing!  There are many sauces to choose from but the majority don't live up to their names and are odd tasting.  The menu set up is simple to read but the only standard meats are chicken breast, chicken katzu, grilled tofu and grilled veggie.  All other proteins, like steak and shrimp, are $1.50-$2 upgrades which really reduced the cost effectiveness of this meal.  The icing on the bland mess is that it was 80-81 degrees in the restaurant the whole time we were in there.  It was almost a releife to go outside!  Overall this place was an over priced, extreme disapoibtment! I'm so glad I didn't make a special trip to try this place as I left sweaty, irritated and profoundly unsatisfied.  I don't think I would eat the small leftovers I have even if I were starving and they were all I had.  Feed your eyes on their Instagram and then go to Makai Grill to satisfy you taste buds and belly!

LXMna8xoY53JqVyBRfzX_Q.text: Actually never heads of this place but I was at the "Bite Las Vegas" event on Saturday and had a few bites of this (filet mignon n rice). It had a good flavor/marinade etc. So we decided to try out the place for lunch today. It looked like you would get more of a larger portion but I was ok with it since it was lunch maybe thats a lunch portion. I ordered the 2 proteins plate,2 sides w fried rice. The other order was a 3 protein. Total-$28. I ordered the filet mignon paid $2.99 extra and "well done". I cut open the steak and it was literally rare! Yuck- I could NOT even eat it. So disappointed. I mean theres a huge difference btwn well done & rare I'm not a culinary graduate but come on. I called the restaurant back asked for a manager she didnt get anyone else just took my name down and added it to the "list of wrong orders" soo I was still hungry and "next time" they would give me a free meal. Ugh. Just doesnt help when you have 1/2 of your lunch inedible.

lfSS5VjtkotYd1vjyRndNw.text: I tried this place for the first time last week and got it delivered. I was excited after the pictures and reviews to try it out.   I got the plate with 3 proteins and expected more food for the price especially considering I paid extra for the spicy garlic sirloin and to add shrimp. I got barely any shrimp at all and the chicken was quite dry. I was sad about the shrimp because it was actually quite good and so was the steak. The spring rolls were alright, but nothing special. A highlight were all of the sauce options and they were really good. I got the salad with ginger dressing which I also enjoyed.   Overall, I did enjoy the food for the most part. I wish it came with a little more because I got a bunch of chicken and less of the meats I paid extra for. I would give them one more shot, maybe I'll eat there instead of takeout and see if I have a better experience.

RouoUgpOZHSjhTDtBeW9cQ.text: Ordered a pickup order from here after work for my lunch and it looked good. Pickup was convenient and they had everything ready for me. I checked in on yelp for my free drink. I ordered the 3 large combo protein and got steak, spicy chicken, and shrimp. I also got yakisoba noodles with veggies for my side and I also got a salad along with it. I got home and tried the food and it was alright. Was disappointed that I paid extra for shrimp and they only gave me 4 small pieces of shrimp. The chicken was kind of rubbery to me but the steak was fine. The salad was ok. I don't think they achieved the right flavor they named the salad after. The sauces on the side was actually good. I dipped it with all my food and then eventually poured it on top. I would have to say $16 for this meal, I expected more.

yLrI_sG-FimPLdjxpQg6gw.text: Hats off to Chef Ken! Volcano Grille is Hot Hot Hot! Everything here is delicious, fresh and made to order. So good!  I have been here before but last night I brought my daughter in, as she has never eaten here before. We both ordered the small bowls but there was so much food we brought some food home. We also shared a chocolate molten cake last night too which is one of my favorites here.  Ordering is simple you get to choose your protein, rice or noodles and sides. The filet mignon here is good as well as the chicken katsu and the salmon. You have your choice of brown rice or white rice if you like to choose. My daughter didn't want any rice so she ordered double vegetables which worked out well for her. You can create your bowl the way you want it.  they also have an assortment of house-made sauces which are quite incredible. I love the spicy teriyaki and the wasabi sauce, I used it on everything!   I love the idea that this place is not too far from my house meaning I can stop by quite often and choose different meal combinations. If you haven't tried v8olcano Grille you are missing out!   So much goodness here! Yummm!

CM-kdeTSOiEA0Wqjxuv9Dg.text: I spent $17 for a small plate with not enough food. Disappointing. (There are 2 egg eolls but I ate 1.) Paid extra money to receive a tiny piece of salmon and 4 pieces of shrimp? Then serving a ton loads of onions to over compensate for the actual veggies. C'mon guys.

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Disappointing $17.00 spent. Is it worth it? S Tiny salmon piece and 4 shrimp pieces I had to pay extra for.

bdwpIaRjjTpqxK5w9gA2_g.text: Decided to try this place based on good Yelp reviews, and we are glad we did!  The inside is actually pretty spacious with table seating and booths in the back. They have a miniature Coca-Cola freestyle machine!  It doesn't have as many flavors as the larger version, but it's a big upgrade from a basic fountain or, even worse, soda in cans.   Check-in on Yelp for two free gyoza or a free soda.   I tried one of their "plates" with three proteins, two sides, a salad, and a rice or noodle. I tried the katsu, grilled chicken, and filet mignon (a slight up-charge for this - I think about $2). I got yakisoba and grilled vegetables as well, but I forget what else (sorry!).   Everything was really good!  The meats were all tender and flavorful, and the katsu was lightly breaded and not overly fried or greasy. I remember everything else was also very good. Of course, I tried the freestyle machine for some vanilla Diet Coke - yum!  The staff were super friendly, and the to-go order took about 15 minutes to be ready.   This is a great dining option for familiar food choices with an asian flair!

WwEmW2TuTZzTy_C2wLjiJw.text: Food is aight as a post workout meal!   Service wasn't friendly! Except from the cook! He's AWESOME so upbeat and polite! Service with a smile is always my favorite! The cashier in the front looks and acts like he hates his life there. Not one smile, not one "how are you." It was one of those conversations where we initiated and asked how he was and his response was, "good" .....oh ok I guess the conversation was one sided, typical Vegas!   Don't get the egg rolls they're extra mushy on the inside! Weird feeling in your mouth but not a terrible after taste! The cashier also recommended the strawberry salad, (note: there are no strawberries in the salad) super confusing! The salad looked like a sesame ginger salad which is one of the 3 salad options! But he said if there are wonton strips on top, then it's the strawberry salad! .....I'm still confused, so what makes it a strawberry salad?   Hm...I would come back if I'm too lazy to cook and I'm starving after a workout!

u3KEuISfXFCDib0uJJaWPw.text: I sampled Valcano Grille at Bite of Las Vegas. It was BY FAR my favorite dish at this fest. Their Filet Mignon was totally worth a frequent drive from Nellis AFB. (The complete other side of town, for those who don't know).

GE4_yYXG7NgrnMNHlA3MyA.text: This places teeters between a three and a four for me so let's say this is a 3.5....the food is good which is always the number one factor on my reviews however the reason why it can also be a three is the value of it. You're essentially paying a lot more for less at Volcano Grille than say...Ter..... .......  Again food is good. I had the:  Plate combo w/ Filet Mignon, Spicy Garlic Chicken, and Premium Salmon, White Rice, Gyoza, and noodles....you would think that a fat ass like me would be full off all that food but helllll nah. When you can see see a lot of the plate that the food came on, unless the food is rich as fuck you know you ain't getting full.   Besides that....Steak was good, salmon was good, the sauce on the chicken was ehhh, gyoza was ok, noodles were good and the salad it came with (Miso Strawberry) was interestingly good. Another note that I was impressed with was all the sauces that they had in the condiment bar.

3d5GGIWq-aw3bL22erpduQ.text: Ordered a plate which starts at $10 and gives you the option to choose 3 proteins, 2 sides, rice or noodles, a salad and 3 sauces. So I chose spicy filet mignon, chicken katsu, shrimp, grilled rice and veggies, egg rolls and also ginger salad.. teriyaki, ginger, and fuji yummy for the sauce.   It sucks that most of the protein costs extra but I like that you get variety for a meal and it was really good. The portion is a good size for someone like me who doesn't eat too much in one sitting so I had left overs. For someone who eats more and/or a guy, I don't think it'd be enough.   The sauces didn't come labeled but it wasn't hard to figure out. I really liked the ginger sauce. The food was delicious but the shrimp and veggies could lay low on the salt a little.   Overall, I think it's worth the price and I would definitely order here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy filet mignon, ckn katsu, shrimp, grilled rice/veggies, eggrolls, ginger salad. Teriyaki, ginger, and fuji yummy sauces

TPd6Z19LFJLkyt8TMMvhTw.text: Order two Plates for take out. The grilled rice and vegetables were super salty, ended up throwing them away. A little disappointed. The shrimp and beef were good.

mM6MWZH1vP0OweqqeEorQA.text: This place has been on my wishlist forever. When I got there I decided to go with the plate, which included 3 protein, with rice or noodles, and 2 sides. I went with the spicy chicken katsu, filet mignon, shrimp, yakisoba Noodles, grilled vegetables, and gyoza. With a miso strawberry salad on the side. It was roughly $16 because the spicy Katsu and filet mignon was a protein upgrade. The spicy chicken Katsu was amazing! I love the spicy/sweet sauce it comes with. It was so tasty. The filet mignon was a little dry, which is why it's 4 stars to me, there was a sauce you could get there called the spicy teriyaki sauce, which kind of made up for the dryness of the steak. And I had about 4 tiny pieces of steak. The shrimp wasn't all that flavorful. The yakisoba Noodles were pretty good but I had a tiny portion which was not even close to being enough. The strawberry miso salad was pretty tasty, I liked the strawberry vinaigrette. But THAT SPICY CHICKEN KATSU WAS SOOO GOOD, I would come back just for that. And the spicy teriyaki sauce was amazing! Overall food was 8/10. And the Japanese decor there was pretty interesting. And the staff was sweet and helpful. Oh and don't forget to get mochi ice cream on the way out! It was a nice finishing touch :)

fGllmNroZiVrgXe5pMOZiw.text: Volcano Grille is the place to go to for fast-casual Japanese grill items on a budget!   A couple highlights first. I love how many sauces they have for you, readily available for you to pour as much as you need, and in a convenient self-serve station...though all of them were a little too sweet for my liking. I was also impressed with how engaging and proactive the services from the staff were...rather hard to come by these days, especially in a fast food kind of set up.  Three of us came in for lunch here since the boss was very positively inclined toward their food. I ordered a lunch bowl. It comes with choice of rice or noodle, salad or other appetizer, and your choice of protein...I opted for Shrimp. One simple bowl with chopsticks and many sauces to choose from...one can be very satisfied, considering the price, for under $7.   The yakisoba style noodles were cooked perfectly chewy, but a bit too sweet for my liking! The salad was fresh, though, again, the dressing was too sweet! In my humble opinion, food, especially in affordable restaurant, can easily hide its True deliciousness behind the sweetness of sauces and preparations in order to please the masses. This is saddening, because there is more potential here that will never be realized.    Everything was convenient here. I love their automatic door. Ordering is easy and simple, with understandable choices. Then get a table and grab a sauce, or five, while you wait for your food. The staff will bring you your order...and even pour more drinks for you, as well as asking you if you need anything, whenever they have a chance. My simple request, if you haven't figured it out yet, just make it less sweet please!  -2018 reviews #29-

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Bowl with Shrimp, Noodle, Salad with Egg Roll

FhVkmrLMSSSpNBK3tEBZpQ.text: We have ordered lunch here several times via Grubhub.. the orders have been accurate, delivered hot and delicious.  Tonight we decided to stop by their store front and order take-out for dinner. After placing the order, for a family of six our bill was $75.. trying to pay we hit a snag they wouldn't accept a hundred dollar bill.. instead recommended I pay with a card.... huh wait. What?  We were told that "if the owners were here they may make an exception".. it's interesting that as a small business they make it hard on themselves to accept someones monies. It isn't like I came in, ordered a coke and then wanted to pay with a Benjamin!  Second snag.., we are waiting for our order to be ready, the person who took our order says "sorry more bad news, we are out of salad".. so no big deal we will make other selections for four of the six meals..  Third snag.., lady comes over. She is the one checking orders and bagging orders (hair down to her butt).. not that I am hating on her hair, it's actually beautiful hair. It just wasn't tied up, no hair net, I mean c'mon it's food!! Tie it up.. additionally, she isn't wearing gloves, and she has long faux acrylic nails on.. gross   I'll just stop there.. sad

uaS1MbWaO3l3KGxNIA4WEg.text: Oh man, This place is AMAZING! It's definitely a hidden GEM! I have seen this place a few times when I was in the area, but I never stepped inside until now. Right when you step in your smacked in the face with an amazing aroma.  It definitely grabs your attention immediately. The menu is straight to the point, and very easy to understand, the only problem is you don't know what to order, everything looks and sounds good.  This is definitely a place you need to come back to try everything you want. I normally settle for the Salmon, but have found myself craving the filet mignon, definitely favorite cut. The Yakisoba noodles are always my go to side with Rice. I have a hard time choosing between the fried and white Rice (I love rice) I would recommend trying their Vegan Fried Rice (so much flavor). I also recommend saving room for the dessert, The chocolate Lava Cake is my favorite, I am not a big Matcha fan, but my husband couldn't stop Talking about their Matcha Lava Cake, IG your not a in a Cake kind of mood I definitely recommend grabbing some mochi ice cream, my favorite is alway the chocolate, vanilla, mango and strawberry. i also love that they have a sauce bar, I love thr Japanese salsa and hot magma- it definitely amplifies the food and takes it to another level. I definitely will be back for more and I can't wait to grab another dessert, writing about it has definitely got me craving more!

dJoRZJgjm-nzA-199DLtbQ.text: I have passed by Volcano Grille many times when driving on Durango, but never stopped in until recently. The day that I came here, it was very quiet. There were a few people eating their bentos outside and one other person inside the restaurant. I decided to get the Big Bento and did not realize that some of the proteins were extra charge. No big deal, but it was kind of expensive for average food. I wanted salmon and tofu, but the employee apologized and said that they were out of tofu. So I chose the beef instead, along with brown rice and spring rolls. I waited about 10 minutes for my to go order, but I didn't mind. I like how everything is made to order, unlike places like Panda Express where you never know how long the food has been sitting out.   My food was still hot and fresh when I got home. I really liked the beef. It was tasty, cooked well and delicious! The salmon was alright. I regret not taking home some of the sauces from their sauce bar, which probably would have made it better. However, another customer was taking his sweet time at the sauce bar the entire time I was waiting for my food. I think he took one of everything, LOL. The spring rolls were bland tasting and not recommended.   Overall, customer service was friendly and the restaurant was very clean. I didn't think the food was worth $16, although the beef was pretty good. I wouldn't mind coming back to try their other options, but for the price, I can get better food elsewhere.

xjVZXUYkUZZHVHo4kPqugQ.text: I frickin love this place for a whole variety of reasons.   1.  The food is always great.  2.  The staff is always amazing and even better accommodating. 1BhlBChfDEc2kLs-YytiIA.text: UPDATE:  Although this was one of my favorite places to eat, I visited Volcano Grille yesterday and brought 3 new customers with me.  Evidently, the manager and staff are misinformed on laws pertaining to service animals.  I have a physical disability in which I require a service animal.  I was asked for my service dog's ID, which violates the American Disabilities Act.  When I spoke with the manager and showed her the laws pertaining to the ADA, she then told me it would be okay that I stayed but would need to sit away from any other patrons.  Isolation from other patrons is another violation of the ADA.    It has been extremely difficult in the past 3 years adjusting to a new life having CRPS, the most painful condition ever recorded, but feeling as if I am being discriminated against because of it just adds to the difficulties.  Needless to say, I won't be returning to Volcano Grille.  UPDATE:  After posting this review, I was immediately contacted by ownership to apologize and ask how to make this situation right.  The owner agreed to post the laws concerning service animals in his business for all employees to read.  I appreciate the owner's interest in turning a bad situation into a positive one.

IshFXHqdLlnIcLOgscDbuA.text: My husband and I have been coming here since they opened and it is still our favorite place to go the owners are really nice. tTeryi2gA8DmK1VFMwB3Cg.text: Was looking forward to trying this place based on the reviews, but probably won't go out of my way to try again.  It was kinda neat to enter through an automatic sliding door. When I entered, the place was empty, but not a big deal. I approached the counter and there were several employees at the front, but none of them greeted me or seemed to care that there was a customer there.  But I decided to order a bowl with Angus beef. Specified that I wanted it 'to go'.  While I waited for my food, I perused the sauce bar and ladled a few of them to try.  Then I sat down and waited for my order. One of the employees brought me my order but they neglected to realize that I had wanted it for takeout.  Honest mistake, so no biggie.  When I got home, I was disappointed in the portion size of the bowl. It was almost all rice and veggies and very little actual meat. The beef itself was tender, but I really didn't feel as I got my money's worth.   Loved the sauce bar, but it alone doesn't make me want to come back.

ca2x1uzQiloxpaHqwRZMSQ.text: Please go here! The food is great, the menu can be a little confusing if it's your first time there. However they are more than helpful! I'm a customer for life.

B_PH_ecmcX-nBvSLAChLiw.text: Absolutely delicious! You can taste the quality and care in each bite. The girl who took our order was very sweet and very patient with all my questions. The beef and chicken were lean and flavorful. The fried rice and noodles were also very tasty. My favorite was the side salad with the tasty ginger dressing. I can't wait to go back!

BQk-muGLSxA1DLzj7QAZmA.text: Very good place to grab a quick bite to eat and the service is always good.  I do t really fault the business when the service is not that great because you get people who are just having a bad day and that shouldn't reflect on the business.  Just let someone know what's going on if you have some issues!  Overall, I like it and would go again and recommend it.

kz_xFp7NPswm7nP-eB2_fg.text: Been here a fair amount of times. I usually call in a to-go order after work. I have yet to actually eat here at the establishment but it doesn't really matter.  I recommend the Bento Box $10.49. You get 2 items and 2 sides. There's a decent amount to choose from, although, most of the items you have to pay a little extra (such as the Certified Angus Beef +$2.15, Shrimp +$2.35, Premium Salmon +$2.99, Shrimp Tempura +$1.15). The ones that come at just the bento box are chicken breast, tofu, and grilled vegetables. So most of the stuff are at a little extra charge. I usually get the beef and tofu. Tofu isn't what I expected but still enjoyable nonetheless. The portion for the beef is very small so just a heads up.  In terms of sides, I usually get white japanese rice and grilled veggies. The gyoza in particular is better than expected, so definitely recommend that.  If you don't want the bento box, they also have the $7.99 bowl which gives you 1 choice of protein, and either 1 rice or noodle. I have yet to get that since I prefer the bento box but this is a great option if you're not as hungry.  Service is great. You only interact with the one cashier pretty much and they've always been friendly to me.

Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7jWRYsgygTn6nDGEGGdG7g.text: Holy COW!!!! What a discovery!! I'm clearly the last person to hear about this place based on the plethora of incredible reviews.   My boyfriend and I came here yesterday for lunch after I scoped it on Yelp. The boyfriend almost* vetoed it, because "how good can a bento box really be?"  It can be INCREDIBLE!   He had the steak bento with the salad, brown rice and veggies. I opted for the chicken breast, salad, veggies and brown rice.  The steak here is incredible. Seriously. I know what you're thinking... c'mon Laney, how good could it possibly be? Well... it's tender, not chewy, not stringy, and tastes like the ribeye at Hakkasan. Boom.  The chicken; also fantastic!! It comes cooked in garlic and is all white meat with no chewy-tendon-y pieces.   The brown rice was perfectly cooked, the veggies were fantastic-- not mushy or weird-- super fresh.   Couple the fantastic meal with the fact that they have an entire sauce bar and I'm in my happy place. The sauce bar has teriyaki, spicy teriyaki, spicy mayo, yum yum sauce, creamy miso, wasabi dressing and more.  Some people complain about the pricing at this place, but it's really not that bad! Wouldn't you rather pay a couple dollars extra for an incredible meal, rather than get a cheap crap meal? Life's too short for bad food!  *Will be coming here again, and again, and again!!

2oK4BTbSe0GQFYWPR1QkTA.text: Our first visit to Volcano Grille was amazing.  It was like going to Benihana's and paying a fraction Of the cost the staff was also very pleasant. Great atmosphere and good music!!!

pVu8INkgLJ8jTMrMVqEp_Q.text: Such amazing food!!! It was a great find ! I got the bowl with salmon.. I loved all the fresh sauces that they available.   It was a little on the pricey side, but it was still worth it since the food was really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hNRtHEFAq8BoUQ-6YNl3eQ.text: This place is my go to for an after school lunch treat. I usually order the bento box and share it with a friend which usually gets us pretty full, but the dessert is what usually fills us up all the way.   I've had the yakisoba, fried rice, chicken, shrimp, beef, mixed veggies, tofu, and salmon. I like to switch it up each time I go. Everything is usually pretty flavorful, but not too salty, which I like. The flavor of the tofu wowed me, I thought it would be pretty flavorless and I would have to add one of their large selection of sauces on top, but surprisingly, I was able to eat it without.   The only part I don't like is that sometimes the food is overly oily. Once we had yakisoba that was sitting in a pile of oil :/ We ate the top half, but left the extra oily noodles on the plate.   I like that they have a variety of sauces that you can play around with. Personally, I like the magma and the yum yum sauce.   Each time I come here, I order their dessert. They only have one option, but it's pretty good. Especially for someone with a sweet tooth. It's a warm chocolate cake/moist brownie with a scoop of ice cream on top. The two temperatures combined makes a wonderfully delicious combination. Definitely would recommended those with sweet cravings to try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Definitely satisfies my sweet cravings!

k-lJQI8uuEkZrQ-wfaX0PQ.text: I've been going to this place since they were at the buffalo location! Great tasting food!  Hibachi style food at a Togo price. It's not cheap, but with every penny you spend. I've had almost everything on the menu and I can't speak negatively about anything! Wait... Yes I can! Because of how tasty their food is, everyone come here for lunch, making the lines long... But I get around that by calling ahead my order!  Lol.   They have a sauce bar! Fresh sauces to select to be placed on your deliciously grilled protein! You can eat it without the sauce because the chicken comes with a garlic glaze on top!!!! It's to die for!  This is my spot hands down!!!! I've run into a few people that I haven't seen in years.... It's the "in" place to go!!!! Lol.

LXh0b87HyTCnOxpSxqAjsQ.text: TOFU! Did I say Tofu? LOL I usually get the bento and I used to get it with chicken, but me love tofu long time! If you havent gone here, its a must try!   The sauce bar is amazing! So many sauces to choose from. The salad and their dressing is also delish!   I had the steak but it was a little tough, so tofu it is! OHHH and they are open on Sundays now.

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauce bar is awesome!

oITNMjkRCu3hTMElUB_kkw.text: The front door is just like those in Japan! It slides open. It's on a motion sensor. Cooks look like sumo wrestlers.  I feel like I'm in Japan! Food is served in a Bento Box! They are so cool! Nothing gets mixed up! You pay a premium for plastic that is just wasted.   If you check-in you get a free appetizer. They use quality meat; Tender Steak! They Up-charge for all meat except chicken, and tofu.   Fun place!!!

IzjS0UT6FHMfBXe3D6GDLQ.text: The food here is fresh and delicious. We had a shrimp and steak bowl- steak was tender & shrimp was fresh.  We also had a vegetarian bowl with noodles. The ginger salad and the spring rolls are wonderful. Presentation is beautiful.

Q4gANzrhhFe0cTvZG85ixw.text: I have been here three times and the service is always pleasant and the seating is comfortable if you decide to eat there. Never had to wait too long for the food to come out. The food is extremely tasty. I'll admit it might just be a little overpriced, but I enjoy the food and the menu so I'll keep coming back.  I always order the angus beef, you cannot go wrong with that. Decided to order the grilled tofu and I've never had better tasting tofu before! Give it a try!

nmMA2i0KbLJVX-DzI1I8eA.text: I have heard good things about Volcano, and now I'm here. The food is fresh and flavorful. They have a lot of sauces to enhance your meal. I ordered the chicken katsu with brown rice. Really great. Comes with a salad and a side. I got the spring roll. I'm definitely coming back!

IZ0WS0AOrkN3A551jqLtKw.text: Great place for lunch . They offer a variety of Asian fusion bento boxes.  I normally get chicken and steak along side shrimp tempura and grilled rice. They have a sauce bar to liven up your protein. My favorite is the yum yum

mGzcangI6QVIWhJ0uwNxvw.text: Had always seen this place when I'm at Stacks and Yolks so I was more than eager to try it.   Honestly, it was really just like any other terriyaki/hawaiin/japanese fast food restaurant. The food wasn't bad don't get me wrong but nothing really stood out about it. The price however did, its actually a little bit pricey for what it is.   So there really is only 3 options on the menu but the concept of picking your own protein and side adds a little fun to the process. What I liked however was their "sauce bar". They had quite a few different sauces to pick from to add to your meats. My favorite the wasabi sauce, DELICIOUS! The sauce bar definitely made the experience different and worth the trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bento box. Steak, salad, brown rice &amp; grilles veggies

qvtA55EvQ_1002NANcrQ5w.text: I visited the place based on 4 out of 5 stars. First impression was a less than enthusiastic cashier. She drank soda while working the register, and never smiled. I am a picky customer in only one area, and that is customer service & cleanliness. This placed failed at both polite staff, and a clean environment. The side area was disgustingly dirty as well as other parts of the restaurant. I didn't dare venture into the restroom. Food was not good because it was cold and had no flavor, and was very overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T2hH8Wibj9UEPDsKA1NJ1g.text: I got the smothered burrito with tofu and it was HUGE! So much food for such a great price, and of course delicious as well! I will definitely be coming back for more

vmq8d6A94TMTZ09OjOOFnA.text: I really like coming here. Service is super quick, the cashier is friendly and there's never any lines. I usually get the lunch bowl (even for dinner) and it's a good amount of food to keep me satisfied for a long time. I do have a couple of complaints though. One, the prices are a little expensive for their protein sides. Their salmon is an up charge of $2, which I don't mind paying for, but I wish I was a bigger cut. Two, they could lower their sodium level in their food. The grilled rice is a little salty, in my opinion. Regardless, I'll probably continue to come.

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hair

hVIlNFTpdzjfeMhj0fZs1Q.text: I haven't been coming to this place since they moved locations and got rid of my beloved Japanese omelette, but I've lately been craving their array of yummy sauces and easy/reasonably healthy and well-priced dinner options. I basically hate the way my husband and most people cook chicken, but here they cut their chicken into bite-sized portions (yes, I am a child who values this) and have amazing fried rice and grilled veggies to pair it with. Their tofu is also a very good option for those who are non-meat inclined, but it doesn't eat the Japanese omelette, which I'm still hoping beyond hope they bring back.   If I'm struggling for where and what to eat and I'm more inclined not to feel sluggish after, but still want that pop of flavor, I'll make my way here for a bento or a BIG bento (two proteins). Ordering ahead is very easy and they are more efficient at this new location. They also play some great RnB music here that the staff, and some customers, will sing along to. The sliding door up front is a bit weird, cause it doesn't open very quickly when you're in front of it, but at least those people ordering massive to go orders get some help on their way out.

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. big bento of fried rice, grilled veggies, chicken and tofu

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iCfpmsig99P-_t3icmf10Q.text: I love it so much.  It is like a fast food Benihana.  The ginger sauce and Japanese salsa are the bomb.  We thoroughly enjoyed our lunch .  The owner said they may be opening a location in Henderson.  Green Valley please!!!!

XVJrjbrUGGh7w4K-2E9X-A.text: Don't waste your money go to Benihana or Musashi's. They will rob you for your money!!!! They gave me piece of salmon 1 scoop of rice 3 pieces of shrimp for $25.

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XOEkwMvm6zoFjsieJZ25oQ.text: *****update***** Owner was kind to enough to read my review and invited me back for a free bento box. I have to say... the food to me took a 180. It was outstanding. I eat my meat medium rare or close to rare and it was perfect. The chicken was sooooo much better and the shrimp was nice and large. The bento box is so much food and only like $10-$11. Worth it. I must have come in a bad day the first time. I love this place and the owner is very kind for doing this for me.   Ehhh. It was decent. You don't get a lot of food at all so definitely overpriced for the quality and quantity. I wouldn't recommend unless you're in the mood for this place and it's close/you don't want to travel far. Blah. Good service, though.

yOH5iLUe7GyfqH_1pZfwwg.text: Food is a tad pricey for the little amount you get and it didn't set well with my stomach. But it was flavorful.

InwqUhVBPt46MongeAu0_g.text: We just tried this Japanese steakhouse the first time, didn't know what to expect but we know better than judge the book by its cover! Our Bento boxes were elegant on the outside but most delicious on the inside as you can imagine looking at my pictures here.However they need hot nutty Japanese tea badly! We loved the food and the service both where 5*****!

98_DdOeeMNrUV3zxc3kcrg.text: This is the second time I've eaten here in a week. So delicious!! I get the angus beef and shrimp and practically lick the bowl. Open up in Green Valley please!!

LkUXbjrihBVOmJLSzQnpaQ.text: Good food, good music, great staff, variety, and omg the sauce bar is amazing.   The angus steak upgrade is always worth it. You can tell all of the ingredients are high quality and freshness. I've tried the steak, shrimp, tempura shrimp, salmon, and chicken and all have impressed me.   I recently stopped eating rice so I opted for veggies the last time I was there. I was expecting some lettuce, carrots, broccoli, you know the standard steamed veggies. Nope. What I got was a pile of steamed/seared tasty goodness. Seasoned well, shredded carrots and zucchini, with hand cut broccoli and onions.  I always go for the magma sauce with some lava mixed into it. Amazing flavor and not too much heat.  Next time you're in the area, give it a shot. Your stomach will thank you

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xKh_GrhidnJfT0JOFdvDGg.text: Overall this spot is great for value and flavor. I usually get the Bento box. And, I usually get the double chicken and double gyoza. This time I opted for the seaweed salad but kept everything else the same. It was close to closing and they were a little busy but not really an excuse to mix up my order and give me beef instead of chicken. I was really looking forward to chicken so I was a little disappointed to find they gave me beef. Was a little too busy and too close to closing time to ask for it to be remade so I ate it anyways. Was ok but nothing bothers me more than having an order mixed up. I always hate to ask especially when you can see it's just a bunch of kids because there's no telling what they are going to do to the food on a remake. I will probably not return for this reason. And, I would suggest that at least one adult be working for supervision.

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Cg6_nSg_mz4osxi-EocBgw.text: Really good food, and easy to order menu. The lighting sets a casual, comfortable mood, and the place is always clean! I enjoy eating here when I get a break from work. Jade is amazing! She's always very friendly and she has great customer service! I'm happy she's very good at her job. Thanks again for the great help Jade!  Pros: Good quality food Food is thoroughly cooked Plenty of sauces to choose from Staff is really friendly Clean establishment Easy to find parking Great music  Cons: N/A  Overall: Prices are reasonable. Food tastes great. Staff is friendly. (Stephanie is amazing! She's really courteous and helpful. Very knowledgeable do the menu as well. Thank you!) Location is near lots of other businesses and the sign is visible from the street. I like this place. It's my only 5 star rating on yelp for Vegas. Check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tepanyaki bowl with brown rice and macaroni salad.

Ok5qjVYpkfYXWVItU_Voug.text: I've started to crave this place 2-3 times a week consistently lately. I found it on Yelp and it wasn't too far so I decided to give it a try one day for lunch- now I frequent here and bring friends who always end up loving it also. I always get the Big Bento with Chicken and Angus Beef, grilled Japanese rice (essentially fried rice) and yakisoba noodles (essentially chow mein noodles). So so so good! They all come with small cucumbers and an orange peel which ties in a nice, refreshing flavor.   It is a little pricey, especially if you upgrade the proteins at all (The Angus beef is an extra $2.50 I believe) so it ends up being around $15. It's a good portion of food though and the quality seems excellent so I think it's worth it.  & yes- the sauce bar is awesome! I'm a simple girl so I enjoy the spicy teriyaki sauce most, but there are several fun options to choose from.  Just a heads up- they close at 8 pm sharp- even on weekend nights.

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Big Bento! $13 because the up charge for Steak but soooo good and a big portion!

vl_JK_jwaS238TpAm24R_Q.text: Kind of disappointed in the portion size. I got the bowl with double order of shrimp and was charged twice for the shrimp upgrade to only receive 6 pieces of small shrimp. But to pay 1.79 extra twice to get 6 pieces is sad. 6 pieces used to be the normal portion size.

yH4kqM1UJW8A5e3GWpKtRg.text: The owner got back to be about my missing orders within the hour. Which I greatly appreciated, great customer service is very important for a business! Not to mention their food is so so so delicious ! I will  be eating here a lot more often and will definitely recommend to friends :)  Quality 5/5 Taste 5/5 Customer Service 5/5

For me the beef is worth it very tender. I have had a few times where the bigger pieces of beef are almost rare though... Obviously this still haven't stopped me from going in there! Oh ya don't get me started on all those yummy sauces

0XUJcsmily4UeV4IdLJLug.text: Awesome little spot! Healthy choices for post workout meal. This is probably gonna be my new post work out spot since it's in between my place and LVAC. Love the employees also, they're very helpful and as soon as I came in, they all have a big smile on their face. It's very affordable also. Must try, especially if you're trying to eat clean!

AWkvqX-AEq-M_ud5tWO1dg.text: I love bento boxes and the fact that you can customize what you want is great. I usually get the angus beef and chicken breast. The meat is cooked perfectly. It's moist and flavorful. Some places you go and the chicken is dried out and chewy. They have a sauce bar which is really cool. I like the spicy teriyaki sauce personally. They have real good dressing for their salads. The best part is its close to my house. The front cashier is awesome. She's so polite and always smiling. The customer service is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite Angus Beef and Chicken Breast with 2 sides of salad

r6Sas3SA1CQ-gf6BiD9MZQ.text: Today was my first time trying this place and I'm very pleased.  I ordered a bento ($9) with brown rice, wild caught salmon (huge plus for me), chicken breast, and yakisoba.  I'm not really into these type of food places but this place has me sold!  They also have a wide selection of sauces.    There's also plenty of parking in front of the restaurant.  And the staff is very friendly.  I won't be surprised if I'll be there once a week.

RM0abm_JeY1CDhR66EY3tQ.text: Volcano grille is a hidden gem me and the hubby found like 3 years ago when it was located on warm springs.  It is now located on Durango which is much more accessible and basically down the street from where we live!  I have had the bento box and also the bowl and both are super tasty! The chicken and steak are always most preferred but all the meat is delicious!  Basically, if you like teppanyaki style food without having to go to a fancy restaurant you will LOVE this place! The sauces are delicious! (Ginger and mustard ones are my faves).  The only thing I'd wish they could change is their hours! Open a little earlier like 11! We're always hungry for some lunch around that time but sometimes can't wait til 12 to eat.

NsPt9lJQcXX6auUpOhnQ-A.text: Came here last week on a lunch break and it was surprisingly tasty. I usually don't try anything new but I'm happy I did. They have a sauce bar which is nice if you like lots of sauce like I do.   I had the teriyaki chicken bowl with white rice and no vegetables.  Will be returning soon :)

1N_1-TPJiGdkg7CoHYYpIw.text: I've been to this place for many times for the past 3 years. I like the new location better than the old one. The best fast Japanese food in Town. Steak and chicken are awesome!

On top of me being extremely sick, I had an exam that day. I was unable to study because I was over the toilet all day. Ugh it was the worst pain ever.

_nEQi657j8r8ui84pCsTqQ.text: Funniest thing is that I waited. Till they moved further from me before I tried them.  This location is set up pretty nicely.    I tried the bento box with steak, tofu (yes, they have tofu), fried rice and grilled vegetables.  It was good.  I won't say it's great because that would demean my other reviews.  The food was decent.  I liked the available options and the flexibility.  Pick two from this group, pick two more from the next.  How hard can that be?    And the tofu, extra firm, grilled and had a garlic topping.  Pretty nice option.    I'd go here again.

rHvhzaqYroUdYa6m4K8zfQ.text: The food is tasty but for the price the portions are very very small. Don't come here hungry. The chicken wasn't hot it was warm when I got my bento box. If everything was hot and a decent size portion of a dish for the $10 I would've gave it 5 starts. I think I'll stick with teriyaki madness around the corner.

7mq5DS7rxo78Eb1PSzsIoA.text: Dark and relaxing inside with throw back jams on the speakers, got a kids bowl and I enjoyed it, filled me up perfectly. First time today quick and easy, healthy...I'll be back :)

B-rV9El9tqFkJ4Ih1CwNPw.text: I really want to love this place . I like the food , not love . Convenient . Love the sauce bar! Food is decent quality however , I don't think the steak has ever been cooked well done as I have requested . My biggest complaint would probably be the price of the bento box. By the time you add your meats and sides it cost more than it does to go to Oh Jah and Have the full hibachi cooking in front of you experience.

d7Z8ZKl00TiVrMEGaluV8g.text: can't say I am a fan,as I found the price not so reasonable as most of the proteins had an add charge, which made the lunch headed toward dinner prices??? the food is tasty and had spice/sauce bar, missing was the garlic chili sauce. I needed some of the sauce to give it ba-zing different from the salt seasoning on the fish... And there are other places to eat , so they need to compete with their prices,as it is a drive from summerlin and I probably will not go back, unless someone else treats ,lol....

3enuCXiaqIJhZmwOcLxvGA.text: New fave spot to hit when I'm craving some good food with Asian flare. Their sauce bar is tasty! Loved every bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Volcano Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura and Angus with rice and gyoza as a side. Yummy.

dqerMvGLCAw7nmp6kQbbrQ.text: Just ate here for the first time tonight and it shall be my last. I don't know what they're doing in the kitchen but coating the food in salt and a pepper is not a way to compensate for lack of taste. I will not be returning, it was terrible.

sMhqTHA5c5BELfvbjTa9WA.text: A fast casual dining spot in a strip mall. The food is yummy and they have a sauce bar that gives you so many options. The service is friendly and the plane appears clean and maintained.

fZUrjegKhRtmwCEWxyoCgQ.text: Looks like prices are going up and portions getting smaller. Expensive for what you get though food has been good.

Dyd732lU3fU64wCiSIcDgg.text: Oh my GOSH so yummy I can't eat it fast enough! Brown rice bowl w grilled chix & veggies doused in their house-made "magma" and the "fuji-yummy" sauces (self-serve house-made sauces, there's a dozen or so choices). My friend had a Bento Box - Angus beef, potstickers (aka 'gyoza') dipped in Ponzu sauce, and salad with ridiculously good Asian house dressing. The owners are working the grill, such sincerely nice guys. Great servvce, super fast - it's like Benihana fast-food! I loves me Volcano Grill!!!!! 5 stars! Do yourself a favor and get there, holy cow.

tDxA40mtBQIkeRo9U6nk_g.text: Disappointed, ripped off, disbelief... I'm not sure how to describe my first visit here. I paid $16.21 for the large bento box. The lady behind the register said it came with plenty of proteins and veggies. First off, it doesn't come with veggies. Worse than that, the portions are so tiny that I was absolutely shocked by their stinginess. I'm talking 5 pieces of shrimp and fewer than 10 chunks of beef. To top it off, their noodles are a complete failure. They are worse than Panda Express noodles. I was lied to by their employee and fell completely ripped off by their kid size portions. My advice, seek another establishment unless you like overpaying, still being hungry, and appreciate being lied to.

SJf5zkZbRwShnn__eHOzBQ.text: Hidden gem in strip mall! I wasn't sure what to expect but I was not expecting to be so completely surprised and impressed! The quality of the steak was 5 star restaurant quality and the and the seasonings are beyond good. Amazing selection of about 10 sauces, none of which are necessary but all of which are perfection. Fine dining food with casual ordering and seat your self and quick service with great prices. We need one in L.A.!

fBER8EbI-j_-HWaKBvoUcw.text: Fix that smell!!!!!!  Foods great, service is great, but it's a clear unappealing sewage smell that reeks when you walk in. After a while you get used to the smell so you think you don't smell it anymore but it still there. It could be something as simple as covering a floor drain but whatever it is it needs to be addressed I would've given this place five stars but with that smell when you walk in it's the most unappetizing smell. Pricing is not bad because they give you a lot of food however with all the extras it can add up pretty quickly two Bento boxes with two proteins and two sides upgrading to steak and shrimp and chicken and salmon plus one drink came to just under $30. For a quick service concept I feel like that was a little high however the quality was good the food was delicious and I wouldn't mind coming back again to enjoy it. Please fix that smell and I will be there every day

HXEpdTDR6yntXb08iiDE3A.text: Taste the freshness!!! Good stuff....decent prices...nice employees....and great new location (close to home)....good luck in your new spot.......

N1T5U6ieyzcze_JKecprMA.text: Tasty. Had a quick meal while visiting people in the nearby hospital. Enjoyed all the sauces.

aN6ZWAFDJEC8IIKGP8jUyg.text: cant say enough good things about this meal everything from the meat,sides, service were all top notch.place was clean, good music playing in the background and just a overall good vibe as i was greeted by the cook on my entrance.Yes its a little pricier then going to panda express or the like but the meat was so tender not like a piece of leather at other places,and the shrimp were big and tasted great i will be returning many times for a great meal at the volcano grille...

XMGOYVzQpOguXtEl3VrAyw.text: soooooo good!!! really enjoy all the sauces!!! the food is made fresh to order & is so tasty!!!

ZRTLArDCuX_f3ktaTyYvfQ.text: First time here. It was good. Our favs are the beef, noodles, fried rice (both white and brown were delicious). Grilled veggies were ok. Chicken was ok. Huge portions though.

ktiiY-izoXwMYAZOhIJozA.text: ... WOW! I got the bento box with beef, grilled rice, vegetables and spring rolls it was only $9, I'm stuffed and satisfied!! I ate as much as I could and I still have enough left for a lunch tomorrow! I can't wait to eat here again soon!

Sd2nUnJKv1TBfdIifH3dVA.text: I have got to say that Volcano Grille is seriously one of my favorite places to eat. The first time my husband and I tried it we were shocked at how incredibly tasty the food was. We go every week and they never disappoint. The cashiers are always friendly.  The steak is always choice meat. We get the bento box which is your choice of 4 items and is a great price for the amount of food they give you. Eveything we have ever tasted on the menu has always satisfied us. Oh and they have a sauce bar with some genius sauces. My favorite is the sweet garlic. YUUUMMMM. If youve never tried Volcano Grille I would definitly recommend giving them a shot. Tried sams, tried madness....mehhhh....Volcano Grille is by far the best!

Uust5lBHT7BMDSF5VFUexw.text: Volcano Grille is one of my favorite spots to eat! Their food is high quality, fresh, and simply delicious. Both chefs are amazing at what they do and we ALWAYS enjoy what we get!! From the steak to the chicken to the shrimp, anything you order always ends up being so yummy! They have an excellent array of sauces for dipping and a wide variety of sides. It is an easy location to find and get to and it's definitely affordable!! Volcano Grille is absolutely amazing and I recommend it to anyone and everyone!!! Excellent customer service, excellent food, and an excellent environment.
